title: 6.2 Master Challenge 3
question:
Write a program that creates an integer array and prints only the elements stored at the odd indexes of the array.
For example: int array ={10, 20, 30, 40, 50};

For this array the output should be printed as shown below:


Since the odd indexes in the array are 1 and 3, index 1 stores the value 20, index 3 stores the value 40.
__language_type_hint: python - sql - htmlcss - scratch - javascript - R - pseudocode - java

testcases.value:
Case = Test integer sum
input = 1 2 3 5
output = 11

Case = Test integer sum
input = 1
 -2
 3
 5
output = 7
